title: Acting IGP cracks whip against hampers from junior cops to senior cops
byline: A circular has been issued by Acting Inspector General of Police (IGP) Priyantha Weerasooriya to all senior police officers regarding the tradition of presenting hampers to senior officers of the Sri Lanka Police as part of celebrations on special occasions like New Year’s Eve and Sinhala and Hindu New Year.

title: Arrest warrant issued for impeached S Korea president Yoon
byline: A Seoul court has issued an arrest warrant against South Korea’s suspended president Yoon Suk Yeol over his attempt to impose martial law on 3 December.

title: Inclusion of fake Dr. title before Justice Minister’s name: CID to grill more parliamentary officials
byline: The Criminal Investigation Department (CID ) will interrogate three more officials of the parliamentary staff over the inclusion of the ’Dr’ title in front of the name of Justice Minister Harshana Nanayakkara.

title: Government Printing Department website, police youtube channel hacked
byline: The official website of the Government Printing Department has reportedly been hacked, the Sri Lanka Computer Emergency Response Team (CERT) said.

title: Rocket blasts off for India’s first space-docking mission
byline: An Indian-made rocket has blasted off from a site north of Chennai, carrying two satellites which will test space-docking.

title: Share Covid data, World Health Organization tells China
byline: The World Health Organization has urged China to share data on the origins of the Covid pandemic, five years on from its start in the city of Wuhan.

title: ‘Kiribath’ in jeopardy as rice shortage hits
byline: With the shortage of Nadu and white raw rice varieties in the market, Sri Lankans will find it difficult to prepare traditional milk rice to welcome the dawn of New Year, a trader said.

title: No withholding tax on children’s savings below Rs. 150,000 monthly income
byline: Cabinet Spokesman and Minister Dr. Nalinda Jayathissa today assured that no withholding tax will be charged on interest from children’s savings accounts if the child’s monthly income is less than Rs. 150,000.

title: Govt calls bids for Merapanam, Tenecteplase vaccine supply
byline: International competitive bids have been called by the government for the supply of 900,000 vials from 1 gram Merapanam vaccine used for the treatment of acute bacterial infections and 9,000 vials from 40 mg of Tenecteplase vaccine used for the prevention of deaths due to heart attacks.

title: Probe launched on hacking of websites; Govt. to take steps on data protection: Minister
byline: In the wake of several state institutions’ websites being hacked during the last few days, the government has launched investigations into these matters, Cabinet spokesman Minister Nalinda Jayatissa said today.

title: Two killed, 16 injured in road accident
byline: Two persons were killed and 16 others injured after a van veered off the road and crashed against a rock near the Beragala Viharagala tea factory, Haputale on the Colombo-Badulla main road.

title: A/L results to be released by April
byline: The results of the G.C.E. Advanced Level examination are expected to be released by April 2024, according to Commissioner General of Examinations, Amith Jayasundara.

title: Neglected rice storage facility in Marandagahamula worries locals
byline: The Marandagahamula paddy and rice storage complex constructed about ten years ago has been left to the mercy of the jungle, much to the anxiety of the traders and farmers

title: Emirates launches additional flight to CMB-DXB route
byline: Emirates, the world’s largest international airline, is set to operate an additional scheduled service between Colombo and Dubai, starting from 2 January 2025.

title: Businessman arrested for smuggling Rs. 10 million worth of cigarettes and whisky
byline: A 45-year old busniessman was arrested  for smuggling foreign cigarettes and whisky  worth Rs. 10 million, at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) this morning by the Airport Police.

title: Grade 5 Scholarship Exam: Supreme Court declares State has violated Fundamental Rights of students
byline: The Supreme Court today declared that the Fundamental Rights of the student candidates and petitioners have been violated by the State through the breach of the integrity of Paper I of the Grade 5 scholarship examination conducted on September 15, 2024 due to the breach in confidentiality of three questions.

title: CMC launches special initiative to tackle waste accumulation
byline: The Colombo Municipal Council (CMC) has launched a special initiative to address the growing waste accumulation in Colombo.

title: Grade 1 classes in Govt schools to begin on January 30
byline: Classes for students entering Grade 1 in government schools and government-approved private schools, including Sinhala, Tamil, and Muslim schools, for the year 2025 are scheduled to begin on January 30, the Education Ministry announced.

title: ’Clean Sri Lanka’ programme to be launched tomorrow
byline: The ’Clean Sri Lanka’ programme focusing on areas such as social behaviour, environmental cleanliness and people’s ethical behaviour will be launched tomorrow with the participation of President Anura Kumara Dissanayake at the Presidential Secretariat, Senior Additional Secretary to the President for Finance and Economic Affairs G. N. R. D. Aponsu said yesterday.

title: World Test Championship - State of Play ahead of 2025 final
byline: South Africa’s win over Pakistan sealed their first-ever World Test Championship Final spot, while Australia’s success in Melbourne significantly boosts their chances of Lord’s appearance.
